1â†’# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System
     2â†’
     3â†’**Version**: 1.1  
     4â†’**Target Completion**: TBD  
     5â†’**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)
     6â†’
     7â†’## Overview
     8â†’
     9â†’Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.
    10â†’
    11â†’## Core Goals
    12â†’
    13â†’1. **Replace free-form tags** with structured category-based tags
    14â†’2. **Add category management interface** for creating/editing categories
    15â†’3. **Implement color coding** by category for visual organization
    16â†’4. **Maintain backward compatibility** with existing v1.0 tags
    17â†’5. **Prepare data structure** for AI categorization in v1.2
    18â†’
    19â†’## User Stories
    20â†’
    21â†’### Category Management Stories
    22â†’- **As a user, I want to create custom categories** like "Document Type", "Institution", "Date Range" to organize my specific document types
    23â†’- **As a user, I want to define tag options within each category** so I can select from predefined choices rather than typing free-form text
    24â†’- **As a user, I want to edit categories and their tag options** so I can refine my organization system over time
    25â†’- **As a user, I want to see color-coded tags** so I can visually distinguish between different category types
    26â†’
    27â†’### Tag Assignment Stories
    28â†’- **As a user, I want to assign tags from category dropdowns** instead of typing free-form text for more consistent tagging
    29â†’- **As a user, I want to assign multiple tags per document** across different categories (e.g., "Invoice" + "Q3 2024" + "Bank of America")
    30â†’- **As a user, I want my existing v1.0 tags preserved** and optionally migrated to the new category system
    31â†’
    32â†’## Technical Architecture
    33â†’
    34â†’### Data Structure Changes
    35â†’
    36â†’#### New Collections
    37â†’```javascript
    38â†’// /teams/{teamId}/categories/
    39â†’{
    40â†’  id: "category-uuid",
    41â†’  name: "Document Type", 
    42â†’  color: "#1976d2",         // Primary category color
    43â†’  createdAt: timestamp,
    44â†’  updatedAt: timestamp,
    45â†’  isActive: true,
    46â†’  tags: [                   // Available tag options for this category
    47â†’    {
    48â†’      id: "tag-uuid",
    49â†’      name: "Invoice",
    50â†’      color: "#1976d2"        // Inherits category color with variations
    51â†’    },
    52â†’    {
    53â†’      id: "tag-uuid-2", 
    54â†’      name: "Statement",
    55â†’      color: "#1565c0"        // Darker shade of category color
    56â†’    }
    57â†’  ]
    58â†’}
    59â†’```
    60â†’
    61â†’#### Updated Evidence Structure
    62â†’```javascript
    63â†’// /teams/{teamId}/evidence/{evidenceId}
    64â†’{
    65â†’  // ... existing fields ...
    66â†’  tagsByHuman: [             // Updated structure
    67â†’    {
    68â†’      categoryId: "category-uuid",
    69â†’      categoryName: "Document Type",  // Denormalized for performance
    70â†’      tagId: "tag-uuid",
    71â†’      tagName: "Invoice",            // Denormalized for performance  
    72â†’      color: "#1976d2"
    73â†’    }
    74â†’  ],
    75â†’  tagsByAI: [               // Same structure, ready for v1.2
    76â†’    // Similar tag objects
    77â†’  ],
    78â†’  legacyTags: [             // Preserve v1.0 free-form tags
    79â†’    "invoice", "q3-2024"    // Original string tags from v1.0
    80â†’  ]
    81â†’}
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Color System
    85â†’
    86â†’#### Category Colors
    87â†’- **Document Type**: Blue (#1976d2)
    88â†’- **Date/Period**: Green (#388e3c) 
    89â†’- **Institution**: Orange (#f57c00)
    90â†’- **Custom Categories**: Auto-assigned from predefined palette
    91â†’
    92â†’#### Tag Color Variations
    93â†’- Base category color for primary tag in category
    94â†’- Lighter/darker shades for additional tags in same category
    95â†’- Ensures visual consistency within categories
    96â†’
    97â†’### Component Architecture
    98â†’
    99â†’#### New Components
   100â†’1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
   101â†’2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
   102â†’3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
   103â†’4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
   104â†’5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories
   105â†’
   106â†’#### Updated Components
   107â†’1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
   108â†’2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
   109â†’3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic
   110â†’
   111â†’## Implementation Phases
   112â†’
   113â†’### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
   114â†’- [ ] Create categories collection schema
   115â†’- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
   116â†’- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
   117â†’- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
   118â†’- [ ] Implement data migration utilities
   119â†’
   120â†’### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
   121â†’- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
   122â†’- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
   123â†’- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
   124â†’- [ ] Add category management to navigation
   125â†’- [ ] Create default categories on first visit
   126â†’
   127â†’### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
   128â†’- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
   129â†’- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
   130â†’- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
   131â†’- [ ] Color-coded tag display
   132â†’- [ ] Real-time tag updates
   133â†’
   134â†’### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
   135â†’- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
   136â†’- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
   137â†’- [ ] Batch migration utilities
   138â†’- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags
   139â†’
   140â†’### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
   141â†’- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
   142â†’- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
   143â†’- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
   144â†’- [ ] Category-based organization in results
   145â†’
   146â†’### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
   147â†’- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
   148â†’- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
   149â†’- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
   150â†’- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
   151â†’- [ ] UX polish and error handling
   152â†’
   153â†’## Detailed Implementation Specifications
   154â†’
   155â†’### CategoryManager.vue Interface
   156â†’```
   157â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   158â†’â”‚ Category Management                      â”‚
   159â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

   162â†’â”‚ ðŸ“ Document Type        [Edit] [Delete] â”‚
   163â†’â”‚    â€¢ Invoice                            â”‚
   164â†’â”‚    â€¢ Statement                          â”‚
   165â†’â”‚    â€¢ Contract                           â”‚
   166â†’â”‚                                         â”‚
   167â†’â”‚ ðŸ“… Date Range          [Edit] [Delete]  â”‚
   168â†’â”‚    â€¢ Q1 2024                           â”‚
   169â†’â”‚    â€¢ Q2 2024                           â”‚
   170â†’â”‚    â€¢ Q3 2024                           â”‚
   171â†’â”‚                                         â”‚
   172â†’â”‚ ðŸ¢ Institution         [Edit] [Delete]  â”‚
   173â†’â”‚    â€¢ Bank of America                    â”‚

   175â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   176â†’```
   177â†’
   178â†’### TagSelector.vue Interface
   179â†’```
   180â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   181â†’â”‚ Assign Tags to Document                  â”‚
   182â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
   183â†’â”‚ Document Type: [Invoice      â–¼]        â”‚

   191â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   192â†’```
   193â†’
   194â†’### Migration Strategy
   195â†’
   196â†’#### v1.0 Compatibility
   197â†’1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array

   199â†’3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags
   200â†’4. **Fallback Display**: Show legacy tags when no structured tags exist
   201â†’
   202â†’#### Migration Dialog
   203â†’```
   204â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   205â†’â”‚ Migrate Your Tags                        â”‚
   206â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

   209â†’â”‚ categories?                              â”‚

   215â†’â”‚                                         â”‚
   216â†’â”‚ [Auto-Migrate] [Manual Setup] [Later]   â”‚
   217â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   218â†’```
   219â†’
   220â†’## API Endpoints
   221â†’
   222â†’### Category Management
   223â†’```javascript
   224â†’// Create category
   225â†’POST /api/categories
   226â†’{
   227â†’  name: "Document Type",
   228â†’  color: "#1976d2",
   229â†’  tags: [
   230â†’    { name: "Invoice", color: "#1976d2" },
   231â†’    { name: "Statement", color: "#1565c0" }
   232â†’  ]
   233â†’}
   234â†’
   235â†’// Update category
   236â†’PUT /api/categories/{categoryId}
   237â†’{
   238â†’  name: "Document Types", // Updated name
   239â†’  tags: [...] // Updated tag list
   240â†’}
   241â†’
   242â†’// Delete category (requires reassignment)
   243â†’DELETE /api/categories/{categoryId}
   244â†’?reassignTo=categoryId // Optional reassignment target
   245â†’```
   246â†’
   247â†’### Tag Assignment
   248â†’```javascript
   249â†’// Update evidence tags
   250â†’PUT /api/evidence/{evidenceId}/tags
   251â†’{
   252â†’  tagsByHuman: [
   253â†’    {
   254â†’      categoryId: "cat-1",
   255â†’      categoryName: "Document Type",
   256â†’      tagId: "tag-1", 
   257â†’      tagName: "Invoice",
   258â†’      color: "#1976d2"
   259â†’    }
   260â†’  ]
   261â†’}
   262â†’```
   263â†’
   264â†’## User Experience Flow
   265â†’
   266â†’### First-Time User Experience
   267â†’1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade
   268â†’2. System detects no categories exist
   269â†’3. Prompts to create default categories or set up custom ones
   270â†’4. Creates suggested categories: Document Type, Date, Institution
   271â†’5. User can immediately start categorizing files
   272â†’
   273â†’### Existing User Migration
   274â†’1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade  
   275â†’2. System detects existing v1.0 tags
   276â†’3. Shows migration dialog with suggested category mappings
   277â†’4. User can auto-migrate, manually configure, or postpone
   278â†’5. Legacy tags remain searchable during transition
   279â†’
   280â†’### Daily Usage Flow
   281â†’1. User uploads new document (existing v1.0 flow)
   282â†’2. In Organizer, clicks on document to assign tags
   283â†’3. Selects from category dropdowns instead of typing
   284â†’4. Tags appear color-coded in file list
   285â†’5. Search works across both structured and legacy tags
   286â†’
   287â†’## Testing Strategy
   288â†’
   289â†’### Unit Tests
   290â†’- Category CRUD operations
   291â†’- Tag assignment/removal
   292â†’- Color generation and assignment
   293â†’- Migration utilities
   294â†’- Search functionality with structured tags
   295â†’
   296â†’### Integration Tests
   297â†’- Full category management workflow
   298â†’- Tag assignment across multiple categories
   299â†’- Legacy tag compatibility
   300â†’- Search across mixed tag types
   301â†’- Data migration scenarios
   302â†’
   303â†’### User Acceptance Tests
   304â†’- Create and manage categories
   305â†’- Assign tags to documents
   306â†’- Search and filter by categories
   307â†’- Migrate from v1.0 tags
   308â†’- Color-coded visual organization
   309â†’
   310â†’## Performance Considerations
   311â†’
   312â†’### Query Optimization
   313â†’- Index categories by teamId and isActive
   314â†’- Index evidence by teamId and tag categoryIds
   315â†’- Denormalize category/tag names for faster search
   316â†’- Cache frequently accessed categories
   317â†’
   318â†’### UI Performance
   319â†’- Lazy load category options
   320â†’- Debounced search with structured tags
   321â†’- Virtual scrolling for large tag lists
   322â†’- Efficient color calculation for variations
   323â†’
   324â†’## Risk Mitigation
   325â†’
   326â†’### Data Safety
   327â†’- **No Destructive Changes**: Legacy tags preserved indefinitely
   328â†’- **Rollback Capability**: v1.0 functionality remains available
   329â†’- **Gradual Migration**: Users control migration pace
   330â†’- **Backup Strategy**: Category changes backed up before major operations
   331â†’
   332â†’### User Adoption
   333â†’- **Optional Migration**: Users not forced to migrate immediately  
   334â†’- **Familiar Interface**: Similar to v1.0 with enhancements
   335â†’- **Clear Benefits**: Visual organization and structured data
   336â†’- **Help Documentation**: Migration guides and category examples
   337â†’
   338â†’## Success Metrics
   339â†’
   340â†’### Functionality Metrics
   341â†’- [ ] All v1.0 features continue to work
   342â†’- [ ] Category CRUD operations complete successfully
   343â†’- [ ] Tag assignment works across multiple categories
   344â†’- [ ] Search includes both structured and legacy tags
   345â†’- [ ] Color coding displays correctly
   346â†’
   347â†’### User Experience Metrics
   348â†’- [ ] Migration dialog completion rate >70%
   349â†’- [ ] Average tags per document increases
   350â†’- [ ] Search effectiveness improves with structured tags
   351â†’- [ ] Time to find documents decreases
   352â†’- [ ] User satisfaction with visual organization
   353â†’
   354â†’### Technical Metrics
   355â†’- [ ] Page load times remain <2 seconds
   356â†’- [ ] Tag assignment operations complete <500ms
   357â†’- [ ] Search response time <300ms
   358â†’- [ ] Migration process handles >1000 legacy tags
   359â†’- [ ] Color system supports >20 categories
   360â†’
   361â†’## Future Preparation
   362â†’
   363â†’### v1.2 AI Integration Readiness
   364â†’- Structured tag data format matches AI output requirements
   365â†’- Category system provides framework for AI suggestions
   366â†’- Tag confidence scores can be added to existing structure
   367â†’- Batch processing architecture compatible with category-based workflow
   368â†’
   369â†’### Scalability Considerations
   370â†’- Category system supports unlimited user-defined categories
   371â†’- Tag structure supports hierarchical extensions
   372â†’- Color system expandable beyond current palette
   373â†’- Search architecture supports advanced filtering combinations
   374â†’
   375â†’## Conclusion
   376â†’
   377â†’Version 1.1 transforms the Organizer from a simple tagging system into a structured, visually organized category system while maintaining full backward compatibility with v1.0. This foundation enables more sophisticated AI processing in v1.2 and provides users with immediate benefits through better organization and visual clarity.
   378â†’
   379â†’The implementation prioritizes user experience through optional migration, preserved functionality, and clear visual improvements. The technical architecture ensures scalability and compatibility with future versions while delivering immediate value to users who have already adopted v1.0.

# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System

**Version**: 1.1  
**Target Completion**: TBD  
**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)

## Overview

Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.

## Core Goals

1. **Replace free-form tags** with structured category-based tags
2. **Add category management interface** for creating/editing categories
3. **Implement color coding** by category for visual organization
4. **Maintain backward compatibility** with existing v1.0 tags
5. **Prepare data structure** for AI categorization in v1.2

## User Stories

### Category Management Stories
- **As a user, I want to create custom categories** like "Document Type", "Institution", "Date Range" to organize my specific document types
- **As a user, I want to define tag options within each category** so I can select from predefined choices rather than typing free-form text
- **As a user, I want to edit categories and their tag options** so I can refine my organization system over time
- **As a user, I want to see color-coded tags** so I can visually distinguish between different category types

### Tag Assignment Stories
- **As a user, I want to assign tags from category dropdowns** instead of typing free-form text for more consistent tagging
- **As a user, I want to assign multiple tags per document** across different categories (e.g., "Invoice" + "Q3 2024" + "Bank of America")
- **As a user, I want my existing v1.0 tags preserved** and optionally migrated to the new category system

## Technical Architecture

### Data Structure Changes

#### New Collections
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/categories/
{
  id: "category-uuid",
  name: "Document Type", 
  color: "#1976d2",         // Primary category color
  createdAt: timestamp,
  updatedAt: timestamp,
  isActive: true,
  tags: [                   // Available tag options for this category
    {
      id: "tag-uuid",
      name: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"        // Inherits category color with variations
    },
    {
      id: "tag-uuid-2", 
      name: "Statement",
      color: "#1565c0"        // Darker shade of category color
    }
  ]
}
```

#### Updated Evidence Structure
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/evidence/{evidenceId}
{
  // ... existing fields ...
  tagsByHuman: [             // Updated structure
    {
      categoryId: "category-uuid",
      categoryName: "Document Type",  // Denormalized for performance
      tagId: "tag-uuid",
      tagName: "Invoice",            // Denormalized for performance  
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ],
  tagsByAI: [               // Same structure, ready for v1.2
    // Similar tag objects
  ],
  legacyTags: [             // Preserve v1.0 free-form tags
    "invoice", "q3-2024"    // Original string tags from v1.0
  ]
}
```

### Color System

#### Category Colors
- **Document Type**: Blue (#1976d2)
- **Date/Period**: Green (#388e3c) 
- **Institution**: Orange (#f57c00)
- **Custom Categories**: Auto-assigned from predefined palette

#### Tag Color Variations
- Base category color for primary tag in category
- Lighter/darker shades for additional tags in same category
- Ensures visual consistency within categories

### Component Architecture

#### New Components
1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories

#### Updated Components
1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
- [ ] Create categories collection schema
- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
- [ ] Implement data migration utilities

### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
- [ ] Add category management to navigation
- [ ] Create default categories on first visit

### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
- [ ] Color-coded tag display
- [ ] Real-time tag updates

### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
- [ ] Batch migration utilities
- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags

### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
- [ ] Category-based organization in results

### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
- [ ] UX polish and error handling

## Detailed Implementation Specifications

### CategoryManager.vue Interface

### Migration Strategy

#### v1.0 Compatibility
1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array
2. **Search Integration**: Include legacy tags in search results
3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags
4. **Fallback Display**: Show legacy tags when no structured tags exist

#### Migration Dialog
```

```

## API Endpoints

### Category Management
```javascript
// Create category
POST /api/categories
{
  name: "Document Type",
  color: "#1976d2",
  tags: [
    { name: "Invoice", color: "#1976d2" },
    { name: "Statement", color: "#1565c0" }
  ]
}

// Update category
PUT /api/categories/{categoryId}
{
  name: "Document Types", // Updated name
  tags: [...] // Updated tag list
}

// Delete category (requires reassignment)
DELETE /api/categories/{categoryId}
?reassignTo=categoryId // Optional reassignment target
```

### Tag Assignment
```javascript
// Update evidence tags
PUT /api/evidence/{evidenceId}/tags
{
  tagsByHuman: [
    {
      categoryId: "cat-1",
      categoryName: "Document Type",
      tagId: "tag-1", 
      tagName: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ]
}
```

## User Experience Flow

### First-Time User Experience
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade
2. System detects no categories exist
3. Prompts to create default categories or set up custom ones
4. Creates suggested categories: Document Type, Date, Institution
5. User can immediately start categorizing files

### Existing User Migration
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade  
2. System detects existing v1.0 tags
3. Shows migration dialog with suggested category mappings
4. User can auto-migrate, manually configure, or postpone
5. Legacy tags remain searchable during transition

### Daily Usage Flow
1. User uploads new document (existing v1.0 flow)
2. In Organizer, clicks on document to assign tags
3. Selects from category dropdowns instead of typing
4. Tags appear color-coded in file list
5. Search works across both structured and legacy tags

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests
- Category CRUD operations
- Tag assignment/removal
- Color generation and assignment
- Migration utilities
- Search functionality with structured tags

### Integration Tests
- Full category management workflow
- Tag assignment across multiple categories
- Legacy tag compatibility
- Search across mixed tag types
- Data migration scenarios

### User Acceptance Tests
- Create and manage categories
- Assign tags to documents
- Search and filter by categories
- Migrate from v1.0 tags
- Color-coded visual organization

## Performance Considerations

### Query Optimization
- Index categories by teamId and isActive
- Index evidence by teamId and tag categoryIds
- Denormalize category/tag names for faster search
- Cache frequently accessed categories

### UI Performance
- Lazy load category options
- Debounced search with structured tags
- Virtual scrolling for large tag lists
- Efficient color calculation for variations

## Risk Mitigation

### Data Safety
- **No Destructive Changes**: Legacy tags preserved indefinitely
- **Rollback Capability**: v1.0 functionality remains available
- **Gradual Migration**: Users control migration pace
- **Backup Strategy**: Category changes backed up before major operations

### User Adoption
- **Optional Migration**: Users not forced to migrate immediately  
- **Familiar Interface**: Similar to v1.0 with enhancements
- **Clear Benefits**: Visual organization and structured data
- **Help Documentation**: Migration guides and category examples

## Success Metrics

### Functionality Metrics
- [ ] All v1.0 features continue to work
- [ ] Category CRUD operations complete successfully
- [ ] Tag assignment works across multiple categories
- [ ] Search includes both structured and legacy tags
- [ ] Color coding displays correctly

### User Experience Metrics
- [ ] Migration dialog completion rate >70%
- [ ] Average tags per document increases
- [ ] Search effectiveness improves with structured tags
- [ ] Time to find documents decreases
- [ ] User satisfaction with visual organization

### Technical Metrics
- [ ] Page load times remain <2 seconds
- [ ] Tag assignment operations complete <500ms
- [ ] Search response time <300ms
- [ ] Migration process handles >1000 legacy tags
- [ ] Color system supports >20 categories

## Future Preparation

### v1.2 AI Integration Readiness
- Structured tag data format matches AI output requirements
- Category system provides framework for AI suggestions
- Tag confidence scores can be added to existing structure
- Batch processing architecture compatible with category-based workflow

### Scalability Considerations
- Category system supports unlimited user-defined categories
- Tag structure supports hierarchical extensions
- Color system expandable beyond current palette
- Search architecture supports advanced filtering combinations

## Conclusion

Version 1.1 transforms the Organizer from a simple tagging system into a structured, visually organized category system while maintaining full backward compatibility with v1.0. This foundation enables more sophisticated AI processing in v1.2 and provides users with immediate benefits through better organization and visual clarity.

The implementation prioritizes user experience through optional migration, preserved functionality, and clear visual improvements. The technical architecture ensures scalability and compatibility with future versions while delivering immediate value to users who have already adopted v1.0.

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive review of the implementation plan, here is my assessment:

## **Plan Review Assessment**

**The plan is rejected because it is missing the following mandatory requirements. Please correct and then resubmit.**

### **Missing Mandatory Requirements:**

1. **Executive Summary Problem Statement**: While the plan has an "Overview" section, it lacks a clear executive summary with a formal problem statement and proposed solution structure.

2. **Key Files Line Count Accuracy**: The plan mentions several key files that need modification but:
   - Lists "EvidenceCard.vue" but this file doesn't exist in the codebase
   - States "OrganizerStore.js" but the actual file is "organizer.js" 
   - Doesn't provide accurate line counts for existing files:
     - Organizer.vue: 188 lines (not stated in plan)
     - organizer.js (store): 354 lines (not stated in plan) 
     - TagInput.vue: 276 lines (not stated in plan)

3. **Granular Success Criteria**: While the plan has phases with checkboxes, the success criteria are not granular enough. For example, "Create categories collection schema" needs more specific criteria like "Schema supports minimum 20 categories", "Schema validation prevents duplicate category names", etc.

4. **Complexity and Breaking Risk Estimates**: The plan completely lacks complexity estimates (Low/Medium/High) and breaking risk estimates (Low/Medium/High) for each step.

5. **Rollback Mechanisms**: No steps include rollback mechanisms, which would be required for any step with Medium or High breaking risk.

6. **Internet Research for High Complexity**: The plan lacks internet research summaries for complex steps that would benefit from proven solutions research.

### **Additional Standard Practice Issues:**

1. **File Size Management**: The organizer.js store file has 354 lines, which exceeds the 300-line guideline and should be broken down before implementation begins.

2. **Logical Sequence Issues**: Phase 4 (Migration & Compatibility) is scheduled after Phase 3 (Tag Assignment Interface), but migration should happen before users start using new tag assignment features.

### **Research Summary Required**

For high-complexity steps involving Vue 3 category-based tagging systems, you should perform internet research. Based on my research, here are the key findings that should inform your implementation:

- **Vue 3 Composition API**: Modern Vue 3 applications should use the Composition API with `<script setup>` syntax for cleaner component organization
- **Modular Architecture**: Category-based systems benefit from modular component structure with separate composables for tag management
- **TypeScript Integration**: Strong typing prevents runtime errors in complex tag systems
- **Performance Patterns**: Composable extraction and proper state management prevent memory issues with large tag datasets
- **Component Libraries**: Consider existing solutions like Radix Vue or Nuxt UI for tag input components

### **Recommendations for Revision:**

1. Add a formal executive summary with clear problem statement
2. Verify all file names and provide accurate line counts  
3. Break down the 354-line organizer.js file into smaller modules
4. Add complexity and breaking risk estimates to each step
5. Include rollback mechanisms for risky operations
6. Resequence migration before new feature rollout
7. Add granular, measurable success criteria
8. Include internet research summaries for complex architectural decisions

The technical approach is sound and the feature concept is well-thought-out, but the plan needs structural improvements to meet implementation standards before approval.

Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Vue 3 Composition API best practices for 2024-2025. Here's what the search revealed about building category-based tagging systems and general best practices:

## Vue 3 Composition API Best Practices for Category-Based Tagging Systems (2024-2025)

### **Core Composable Design Principles**

In the context of Vue applications, a "composable" is a function that leverages Vue's Composition API to encapsulate and reuse stateful logic. For category-based tagging systems, this means creating dedicated composables that handle tag management logic.

### **Key Best Practices from 2024-2025**

#### **1. Composable Structure and Organization**
In the case of our system, composables are responsible for storing the main business logic (like calculations, actions, processess) so they are a crucial part of the application. Unfortunately over the time, we didn't have that much time to create some sort of Contract for writing Composables - emphasizing the need for standardized composable patterns.

#### **2. Modern Development Approach**
With this milestone, expect the composition API, Pinia, composables, and TypeScript to be used heavily within Vue apps this year. This indicates the current ecosystem trends for 2024-2025.

#### **3. Reusability and Maintainability**
Vue 3 Composables are a powerful feature introduced in Vue 3, designed to help developers build reusable and maintainable code. By encapsulating logic into composable functions, developers can easily share code across components, reducing duplication and improving code maintainability.

#### **4. Performance Optimization**
Use Vue's computed function to memoize expensive calculations. // src/composables/useCart.js export function useCart() { const items = ref([]); const total = computed(() => { return items.value.reduce((sum, item) => sum + item.price * item.quantity, 0); }); function addToCart(item) { items.value.push(item); } return { items, total, addToCart }; }

#### **5. Lifecycle Management**
Use onMounted to perform heavy operations only when the component is mounted. // src/composables/useHeavyOperation.js export function useHeavyOperation() { const result = ref(null); onMounted(async () => { try { const data = await performHeavyOperation(); result.value = data; } catch (err) { console.error('Error performing heavy operation:', err); } }); return { result }; }

### **Architecture Advantages**

Modular Architecture: Logic is organized into distinct functions, promoting clarity and separation of concerns. No More Scattered Code: Logic resides in a single setup function, enhancing readability and maintainability. Improved Testability: Smaller, focused functions are easier to test and isolate. ... Composable Power: Share reusable logic across components with composables, reducing code duplication and promoting efficiency.

### **Testing and Quality Assurance**
Thanks to the fact that we have moved all the business logic inside the composables (which are basically TypeScript functions) they are very easy to test with Vitest and allows us also to have more stable system.(no content)Vitest for Testing: Use Vitest, a testing framework designed for Vue.js, to write unit tests for components, composables, and state management logic.

### **State Management Integration**
Global State Management: Pinia, the recommended state management library for Vue 3, offers a simple and intuitive API. It helps developers manage global state effortlessly, keeping your application data consistent across components. Local State Management: Use the Composition API to handle local component state, promoting encapsulation and reusability.

### **TypeScript Integration**
In comparison, Composition API utilizes mostly plain variables and functions, which are naturally type friendly.

The search results show that Vue 3's Composition API with composables remains the recommended approach for 2024-2025, with emphasis on modularity, testability, and TypeScript integration for building scalable category-based tagging systems.

content.content:
1â†’# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System
     2â†’
     3â†’**Version**: 1.1  
     4â†’**Target Completion**: TBD  
     5â†’**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)
     6â†’
     7â†’## Overview
     8â†’
     9â†’Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.
    10â†’
    11â†’## Core Goals
    12â†’
    13â†’1. **Replace free-form tags** with structured category-based tags
    14â†’2. **Add category management interface** for creating/editing categories
    15â†’3. **Implement color coding** by category for visual organization
    16â†’4. **Maintain backward compatibility** with existing v1.0 tags
    17â†’5. **Prepare data structure** for AI categorization in v1.2
    18â†’
    19â†’## User Stories
    20â†’
    21â†’### Category Management Stories
    22â†’- **As a user, I want to create custom categories** like "Document Type", "Institution", "Date Range" to organize my specific document types
    23â†’- **As a user, I want to define tag options within each category** so I can select from predefined choices rather than typing free-form text
    24â†’- **As a user, I want to edit categories and their tag options** so I can refine my organization system over time
    25â†’- **As a user, I want to see color-coded tags** so I can visually distinguish between different category types
    26â†’
    27â†’### Tag Assignment Stories
    28â†’- **As a user, I want to assign tags from category dropdowns** instead of typing free-form text for more consistent tagging
    29â†’- **As a user, I want to assign multiple tags per document** across different categories (e.g., "Invoice" + "Q3 2024" + "Bank of America")
    30â†’- **As a user, I want my existing v1.0 tags preserved** and optionally migrated to the new category system
    31â†’
    32â†’## Technical Architecture
    33â†’
    34â†’### Data Structure Changes
    35â†’
    36â†’#### New Collections
    37â†’```javascript
    38â†’// /teams/{teamId}/categories/
    39â†’{
    40â†’  id: "category-uuid",
    41â†’  name: "Document Type", 
    42â†’  color: "#1976d2",         // Primary category color
    43â†’  createdAt: timestamp,
    44â†’  updatedAt: timestamp,
    45â†’  isActive: true,
    46â†’  tags: [                   // Available tag options for this category
    47â†’    {
    48â†’      id: "tag-uuid",
    49â†’      name: "Invoice",
    50â†’      color: "#1976d2"        // Inherits category color with variations
    51â†’    },
    52â†’    {
    53â†’      id: "tag-uuid-2", 
    54â†’      name: "Statement",
    55â†’      color: "#1565c0"        // Darker shade of category color
    56â†’    }
    57â†’  ]
    58â†’}
    59â†’```
    60â†’
    61â†’#### Updated Evidence Structure
    62â†’```javascript
    63â†’// /teams/{teamId}/evidence/{evidenceId}
    64â†’{
    65â†’  // ... existing fields ...
    66â†’  tagsByHuman: [             // Updated structure
    67â†’    {
    68â†’      categoryId: "category-uuid",
    69â†’      categoryName: "Document Type",  // Denormalized for performance
    70â†’      tagId: "tag-uuid",
    71â†’      tagName: "Invoice",            // Denormalized for performance  
    72â†’      color: "#1976d2"
    73â†’    }
    74â†’  ],
    75â†’  tagsByAI: [               // Same structure, ready for v1.2
    76â†’    // Similar tag objects
    77â†’  ],
    78â†’  legacyTags: [             // Preserve v1.0 free-form tags
    79â†’    "invoice", "q3-2024"    // Original string tags from v1.0
    80â†’  ]
    81â†’}
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Color System
    85â†’
    86â†’#### Category Colors
    87â†’- **Document Type**: Blue (#1976d2)
    88â†’- **Date/Period**: Green (#388e3c) 
    89â†’- **Institution**: Orange (#f57c00)
    90â†’- **Custom Categories**: Auto-assigned from predefined palette
    91â†’
    92â†’#### Tag Color Variations
    93â†’- Base category color for primary tag in category
    94â†’- Lighter/darker shades for additional tags in same category
    95â†’- Ensures visual consistency within categories
    96â†’
    97â†’### Component Architecture
    98â†’
    99â†’#### New Components
   100â†’1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
   101â†’2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
   102â†’3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
   103â†’4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
   104â†’5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories
   105â†’
   106â†’#### Updated Components
   107â†’1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
   108â†’2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
   109â†’3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic
   110â†’
   111â†’## Implementation Phases
   112â†’
   113â†’### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
   114â†’- [ ] Create categories collection schema
   115â†’- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
   116â†’- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
   117â†’- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
   118â†’- [ ] Implement data migration utilities
   119â†’
   120â†’### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
   121â†’- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
   122â†’- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
   123â†’- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
   124â†’- [ ] Add category management to navigation
   125â†’- [ ] Create default categories on first visit
   126â†’
   127â†’### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
   128â†’- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
   129â†’- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
   130â†’- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
   131â†’- [ ] Color-coded tag display
   132â†’- [ ] Real-time tag updates
   133â†’
   134â†’### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
   135â†’- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
   136â†’- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
   137â†’- [ ] Batch migration utilities
   138â†’- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags
   139â†’
   140â†’### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
   141â†’- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
   142â†’- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
   143â†’- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
   144â†’- [ ] Category-based organization in results
   145â†’
   146â†’### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
   147â†’- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
   148â†’- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
   149â†’- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
   150â†’- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
   151â†’- [ ] UX polish and error handling
   152â†’
   153â†’## Detailed Implementation Specifications
   154â†’
   155â†’### CategoryManager.vue Interface
   156â†’```
   157â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   158â†’â”‚ Category Management                      â”‚
   159â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

   171â†’â”‚                                         â”‚

   175â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   176â†’```
   177â†’
   178â†’### TagSelector.vue Interface
   179â†’```
   180â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   181â†’â”‚ Assign Tags to Document                  â”‚
   182â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤

   191â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

   193â†’
   194â†’### Migration Strategy
   195â†’
   196â†’#### v1.0 Compatibility
   197â†’1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array
   198â†’2. **Search Integration**: Include legacy tags in search results
   199â†’3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags

   201â†’

   203â†’```
   204â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   205â†’â”‚ Migrate Your Tags                        â”‚
   206â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
   207â†’â”‚ We found 245 unique tags from v1.0.     â”‚

   209â†’â”‚ categories?                              â”‚
   210â†’â”‚                                         â”‚
   211â†’â”‚ Suggested Categories:                    â”‚

   213â†’â”‚ â€¢ Date: 2024, q3-2024, march...        â”‚

# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System

**Version**: 1.1  
**Target Completion**: TBD  
**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)

## Overview

Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.

## Core Goals

1. **Replace free-form tags** with structured category-based tags
2. **Add category management interface** for creating/editing categories
3. **Implement color coding** by category for visual organization
4. **Maintain backward compatibility** with existing v1.0 tags
5. **Prepare data structure** for AI categorization in v1.2

## User Stories

### Category Management Stories
- **As a user, I want to create custom categories** like "Document Type", "Institution", "Date Range" to organize my specific document types
- **As a user, I want to define tag options within each category** so I can select from predefined choices rather than typing free-form text
- **As a user, I want to edit categories and their tag options** so I can refine my organization system over time
- **As a user, I want to see color-coded tags** so I can visually distinguish between different category types

### Tag Assignment Stories
- **As a user, I want to assign tags from category dropdowns** instead of typing free-form text for more consistent tagging
- **As a user, I want to assign multiple tags per document** across different categories (e.g., "Invoice" + "Q3 2024" + "Bank of America")
- **As a user, I want my existing v1.0 tags preserved** and optionally migrated to the new category system

## Technical Architecture

### Data Structure Changes

#### New Collections
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/categories/
{
  id: "category-uuid",
  name: "Document Type", 
  color: "#1976d2",         // Primary category color
  createdAt: timestamp,
  updatedAt: timestamp,
  isActive: true,
  tags: [                   // Available tag options for this category
    {
      id: "tag-uuid",
      name: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"        // Inherits category color with variations
    },
    {
      id: "tag-uuid-2", 
      name: "Statement",
      color: "#1565c0"        // Darker shade of category color
    }
  ]
}
```

#### Updated Evidence Structure
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/evidence/{evidenceId}
{
  // ... existing fields ...
  tagsByHuman: [             // Updated structure
    {
      categoryId: "category-uuid",
      categoryName: "Document Type",  // Denormalized for performance
      tagId: "tag-uuid",
      tagName: "Invoice",            // Denormalized for performance  
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ],
  tagsByAI: [               // Same structure, ready for v1.2
    // Similar tag objects
  ],
  legacyTags: [             // Preserve v1.0 free-form tags
    "invoice", "q3-2024"    // Original string tags from v1.0
  ]
}
```

### Color System

#### Category Colors
- **Document Type**: Blue (#1976d2)
- **Date/Period**: Green (#388e3c) 
- **Institution**: Orange (#f57c00)
- **Custom Categories**: Auto-assigned from predefined palette

#### Tag Color Variations
- Base category color for primary tag in category
- Lighter/darker shades for additional tags in same category
- Ensures visual consistency within categories

### Component Architecture

#### New Components
1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories

#### Updated Components
1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
- [ ] Create categories collection schema
- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
- [ ] Implement data migration utilities

### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
- [ ] Add category management to navigation
- [ ] Create default categories on first visit

### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
- [ ] Color-coded tag display
- [ ] Real-time tag updates

### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
- [ ] Batch migration utilities
- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags

### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
- [ ] Category-based organization in results

### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
- [ ] UX polish and error handling

## Detailed Implementation Specifications

### CategoryManager.vue Interface
```

â”‚                                         â”‚

â”‚    â€¢ Q3 2024                           â”‚
â”‚                                         â”‚

â”‚    â€¢ Bank of America                    â”‚  
â”‚    â€¢ Chase                              â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

### TagSelector.vue Interface
```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚ Assign Tags to Document                  â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
â”‚ Document Type: [Invoice      â–¼]        â”‚
â”‚ Date Range:    [Q3 2024      â–¼]        â”‚
â”‚ Institution:   [Select...    â–¼]        â”‚
â”‚                                         â”‚
â”‚ Current Tags:                           â”‚
â”‚ [Invoice] [Q3 2024]                    â”‚
â”‚                                         â”‚
â”‚ [Save] [Cancel]                         â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

### Migration Strategy

#### v1.0 Compatibility
1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array
2. **Search Integration**: Include legacy tags in search results
3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags
4. **Fallback Display**: Show legacy tags when no structured tags exist

#### Migration Dialog
```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚ Migrate Your Tags                        â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
â”‚ We found 245 unique tags from v1.0.     â”‚
â”‚ Would you like to organize them into     â”‚
â”‚ categories?                              â”‚
â”‚                                         â”‚
â”‚ Suggested Categories:                    â”‚
â”‚ â€¢ Document Type: invoice, statement...   â”‚
â”‚ â€¢ Date: 2024, q3-2024, march...        â”‚
â”‚ â€¢ Institution: boa, chase, wells...     â”‚
â”‚                                         â”‚
â”‚ [Auto-Migrate] [Manual Setup] [Later]   â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

## API Endpoints

### Category Management
```javascript
// Create category
POST /api/categories
{
  name: "Document Type",
  color: "#1976d2",
  tags: [
    { name: "Invoice", color: "#1976d2" },
    { name: "Statement", color: "#1565c0" }
  ]
}

// Update category
PUT /api/categories/{categoryId}
{
  name: "Document Types", // Updated name
  tags: [...] // Updated tag list
}

// Delete category (requires reassignment)
DELETE /api/categories/{categoryId}
?reassignTo=categoryId // Optional reassignment target
```

### Tag Assignment
```javascript
// Update evidence tags
PUT /api/evidence/{evidenceId}/tags
{
  tagsByHuman: [
    {
      categoryId: "cat-1",
      categoryName: "Document Type",
      tagId: "tag-1", 
      tagName: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ]
}
```

## User Experience Flow

### First-Time User Experience
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade
2. System detects no categories exist
3. Prompts to create default categories or set up custom ones
4. Creates suggested categories: Document Type, Date, Institution
5. User can immediately start categorizing files

### Existing User Migration
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade  
2. System detects existing v1.0 tags
3. Shows migration dialog with suggested category mappings
4. User can auto-migrate, manually configure, or postpone
5. Legacy tags remain searchable during transition

### Daily Usage Flow
1. User uploads new document (existing v1.0 flow)
2. In Organizer, clicks on document to assign tags
3. Selects from category dropdowns instead of typing
4. Tags appear color-coded in file list
5. Search works across both structured and legacy tags

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests
- Category CRUD operations
- Tag assignment/removal
- Color generation and assignment
- Migration utilities
- Search functionality with structured tags

### Integration Tests
- Full category management workflow
- Tag assignment across multiple categories
- Legacy tag compatibility
- Search across mixed tag types
- Data migration scenarios

### User Acceptance Tests
- Create and manage categories
- Assign tags to documents
- Search and filter by categories
- Migrate from v1.0 tags
- Color-coded visual organization

## Performance Considerations

### Query Optimization
- Index categories by teamId and isActive
- Index evidence by teamId and tag categoryIds
- Denormalize category/tag names for faster search
- Cache frequently accessed categories

### UI Performance
- Lazy load category options
- Debounced search with structured tags
- Virtual scrolling for large tag lists
- Efficient color calculation for variations

## Risk Mitigation

### Data Safety
- **No Destructive Changes**: Legacy tags preserved indefinitely
- **Rollback Capability**: v1.0 functionality remains available
- **Gradual Migration**: Users control migration pace
- **Backup Strategy**: Category changes backed up before major operations

### User Adoption
- **Optional Migration**: Users not forced to migrate immediately  
- **Familiar Interface**: Similar to v1.0 with enhancements
- **Clear Benefits**: Visual organization and structured data
- **Help Documentation**: Migration guides and category examples

## Success Metrics

### Functionality Metrics
- [ ] All v1.0 features continue to work
- [ ] Category CRUD operations complete successfully
- [ ] Tag assignment works across multiple categories
- [ ] Search includes both structured and legacy tags
- [ ] Color coding displays correctly

### User Experience Metrics
- [ ] Migration dialog completion rate >70%
- [ ] Average tags per document increases
- [ ] Search effectiveness improves with structured tags
- [ ] Time to find documents decreases
- [ ] User satisfaction with visual organization

### Technical Metrics
- [ ] Page load times remain <2 seconds
- [ ] Tag assignment operations complete <500ms
- [ ] Search response time <300ms
- [ ] Migration process handles >1000 legacy tags
- [ ] Color system supports >20 categories

## Future Preparation

### v1.2 AI Integration Readiness
- Structured tag data format matches AI output requirements
- Category system provides framework for AI suggestions
- Tag confidence scores can be added to existing structure
- Batch processing architecture compatible with category-based workflow

### Scalability Considerations
- Category system supports unlimited user-defined categories
- Tag structure supports hierarchical extensions
- Color system expandable beyond current palette
- Search architecture supports advanced filtering combinations

## Conclusion

Version 1.1 transforms the Organizer from a simple tagging system into a structured, visually organized category system while maintaining full backward compatibility with v1.0. This foundation enables more sophisticated AI processing in v1.2 and provides users with immediate benefits through better organization and visual clarity.

The implementation prioritizes user experience through optional migration, preserved functionality, and clear visual improvements. The technical architecture ensures scalability and compatibility with future versions while delivering immediate value to users who have already adopted v1.0.

# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System

**Version**: 1.1  
**Target Completion**: 3 weeks  
**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)

## Executive Summary

### Problem Statement
The current Organizer v1.0 uses a free-form tagging system that creates several organizational challenges:
- **Inconsistent Tagging**: Users type variations of the same concept ("invoice", "invoices", "Invoice")
- **Poor Visual Organization**: No visual distinction between different types of tags
- **Limited Structure**: Cannot group related tags or enforce consistent categorization
- **Search Inefficiency**: Difficult to filter by specific tag types or relationships
- **AI Integration Barriers**: Unstructured data prevents effective AI categorization in future versions

### Proposed Solution
Transform the free-form tag system into a structured category-based system where:
1. Users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date", "Institution")
2. Each category contains predefined tag options with consistent naming
3. Visual color coding distinguishes between categories
4. Structured data enables AI processing in v1.2
5. Full backward compatibility preserves existing v1.0 functionality

### Key Files and Current State
- **Organizer.vue** (187 lines) - Main organizer view requiring category management integration
- **organizer.js** (353 lines) - Pinia store requiring decomposition and category logic
- **TagInput.vue** (275 lines) - Component to be replaced with category-based selection
- **OrganizerHeader.vue**, **OrganizerStates.vue** - Supporting components requiring updates

### Internet Research Summary
**Vue 3 Category-Based Tagging Best Practices (2024-2025):**
- **Composable Architecture**: Logic should be extracted into dedicated composables for tag management, category handling, and color systems
- **Modular Design**: Large files (like 353-line organizer.js) should be decomposed into focused modules
- **TypeScript Integration**: Strong typing prevents runtime errors in complex tag systems
- **Performance Patterns**: Use computed properties for expensive operations, debounced search, and virtual scrolling
- **State Management**: Pinia with Composition API provides optimal state management for category systems
- **Testing Strategy**: Vitest enables comprehensive testing of composables and business logic

## Overview

Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.

# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System

**Version**: 1.1  
**Target Completion**: 3 weeks  
**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)

## Executive Summary

### Problem Statement
The current Organizer v1.0 uses a free-form tagging system that creates several organizational challenges:
- **Inconsistent Tagging**: Users type variations of the same concept ("invoice", "invoices", "Invoice")
- **Poor Visual Organization**: No visual distinction between different types of tags
- **Limited Structure**: Cannot group related tags or enforce consistent categorization
- **Search Inefficiency**: Difficult to filter by specific tag types or relationships
- **AI Integration Barriers**: Unstructured data prevents effective AI categorization in future versions

### Proposed Solution
Transform the free-form tag system into a structured category-based system where:
1. Users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date", "Institution")
2. Each category contains predefined tag options with consistent naming
3. Visual color coding distinguishes between categories
4. Structured data enables AI processing in v1.2
5. Full backward compatibility preserves existing v1.0 functionality

### Key Files and Current State
- **Organizer.vue** (187 lines) - Main organizer view requiring category management integration
- **organizer.js** (353 lines) - Pinia store requiring decomposition and category logic
- **TagInput.vue** (275 lines) - Component to be replaced with category-based selection
- **OrganizerHeader.vue**, **OrganizerStates.vue** - Supporting components requiring updates

### Internet Research Summary
**Vue 3 Category-Based Tagging Best Practices (2024-2025):**
- **Composable Architecture**: Logic should be extracted into dedicated composables for tag management, category handling, and color systems
- **Modular Design**: Large files (like 353-line organizer.js) should be decomposed into focused modules
- **TypeScript Integration**: Strong typing prevents runtime errors in complex tag systems
- **Performance Patterns**: Use computed properties for expensive operations, debounced search, and virtual scrolling
- **State Management**: Pinia with Composition API provides optimal state management for category systems
- **Testing Strategy**: Vitest enables comprehensive testing of composables and business logic

## Overview

Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.

# Organizer v1.1 Implementation Plan: Category-Based Tag System

**Version**: 1.1  
**Target Completion**: TBD  
**Dependencies**: Organizer v1.0 (âœ… Completed August 29, 2025)

## Overview

Version 1.1 transforms the free-form tag system from v1.0 into a structured category-based system where users define categories (e.g., "Document Type", "Date") and assign specific tags within each category. This provides better organization, visual clarity through color coding, and lays the foundation for AI processing in v1.2.

## Core Goals

1. **Replace free-form tags** with structured category-based tags
2. **Add category management interface** for creating/editing categories
3. **Implement color coding** by category for visual organization
4. **Maintain backward compatibility** with existing v1.0 tags
5. **Prepare data structure** for AI categorization in v1.2

## User Stories

### Category Management Stories
- **As a user, I want to create custom categories** like "Document Type", "Institution", "Date Range" to organize my specific document types
- **As a user, I want to define tag options within each category** so I can select from predefined choices rather than typing free-form text
- **As a user, I want to edit categories and their tag options** so I can refine my organization system over time
- **As a user, I want to see color-coded tags** so I can visually distinguish between different category types

### Tag Assignment Stories
- **As a user, I want to assign tags from category dropdowns** instead of typing free-form text for more consistent tagging
- **As a user, I want to assign multiple tags per document** across different categories (e.g., "Invoice" + "Q3 2024" + "Bank of America")
- **As a user, I want my existing v1.0 tags preserved** and optionally migrated to the new category system

## Technical Architecture

### Data Structure Changes

#### New Collections
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/categories/
{
  id: "category-uuid",
  name: "Document Type", 
  color: "#1976d2",         // Primary category color
  createdAt: timestamp,
  updatedAt: timestamp,
  isActive: true,
  tags: [                   // Available tag options for this category
    {
      id: "tag-uuid",
      name: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"        // Inherits category color with variations
    },
    {
      id: "tag-uuid-2", 
      name: "Statement",
      color: "#1565c0"        // Darker shade of category color
    }
  ]
}
```

#### Updated Evidence Structure
```javascript
// /teams/{teamId}/evidence/{evidenceId}
{
  // ... existing fields ...
  tagsByHuman: [             // Updated structure
    {
      categoryId: "category-uuid",
      categoryName: "Document Type",  // Denormalized for performance
      tagId: "tag-uuid",
      tagName: "Invoice",            // Denormalized for performance  
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ],
  tagsByAI: [               // Same structure, ready for v1.2
    // Similar tag objects
  ],
  legacyTags: [             // Preserve v1.0 free-form tags
    "invoice", "q3-2024"    // Original string tags from v1.0
  ]
}
```

### Color System

#### Category Colors
- **Document Type**: Blue (#1976d2)
- **Date/Period**: Green (#388e3c) 
- **Institution**: Orange (#f57c00)
- **Custom Categories**: Auto-assigned from predefined palette

#### Tag Color Variations
- Base category color for primary tag in category
- Lighter/darker shades for additional tags in same category
- Ensures visual consistency within categories

### Component Architecture

#### New Components
1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories

#### Updated Components
1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
- [ ] Create categories collection schema
- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
- [ ] Implement data migration utilities

### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
- [ ] Add category management to navigation
- [ ] Create default categories on first visit

### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
- [ ] Color-coded tag display
- [ ] Real-time tag updates

### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
- [ ] Batch migration utilities
- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags

### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
- [ ] Category-based organization in results

### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
- [ ] UX polish and error handling

## Detailed Implementation Specifications

### CategoryManager.vue Interface
```

```

### Migration Strategy

#### v1.0 Compatibility
1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array
2. **Search Integration**: Include legacy tags in search results
3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags
4. **Fallback Display**: Show legacy tags when no structured tags exist

#### Migration Dialog
```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”

â”‚ categories?                              â”‚

â”‚ Suggested Categories:                    â”‚
â”‚ â€¢ Document Type: invoice, statement...   â”‚

â”‚                                         â”‚

```

## API Endpoints

### Category Management
```javascript
// Create category
POST /api/categories
{
  name: "Document Type",
  color: "#1976d2",
  tags: [
    { name: "Invoice", color: "#1976d2" },
    { name: "Statement", color: "#1565c0" }
  ]
}

// Update category
PUT /api/categories/{categoryId}
{
  name: "Document Types", // Updated name
  tags: [...] // Updated tag list
}

// Delete category (requires reassignment)
DELETE /api/categories/{categoryId}
?reassignTo=categoryId // Optional reassignment target
```

### Tag Assignment
```javascript
// Update evidence tags
PUT /api/evidence/{evidenceId}/tags
{
  tagsByHuman: [
    {
      categoryId: "cat-1",
      categoryName: "Document Type",
      tagId: "tag-1", 
      tagName: "Invoice",
      color: "#1976d2"
    }
  ]
}
```

## User Experience Flow

### First-Time User Experience
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade
2. System detects no categories exist
3. Prompts to create default categories or set up custom ones
4. Creates suggested categories: Document Type, Date, Institution
5. User can immediately start categorizing files

### Existing User Migration
1. User navigates to Organizer after v1.1 upgrade  
2. System detects existing v1.0 tags
3. Shows migration dialog with suggested category mappings
4. User can auto-migrate, manually configure, or postpone
5. Legacy tags remain searchable during transition

### Daily Usage Flow
1. User uploads new document (existing v1.0 flow)
2. In Organizer, clicks on document to assign tags
3. Selects from category dropdowns instead of typing
4. Tags appear color-coded in file list
5. Search works across both structured and legacy tags

## Testing Strategy

### Unit Tests
- Category CRUD operations
- Tag assignment/removal
- Color generation and assignment
- Migration utilities
- Search functionality with structured tags

### Integration Tests
- Full category management workflow
- Tag assignment across multiple categories
- Legacy tag compatibility
- Search across mixed tag types
- Data migration scenarios

### User Acceptance Tests
- Create and manage categories
- Assign tags to documents
- Search and filter by categories
- Migrate from v1.0 tags
- Color-coded visual organization

## Performance Considerations

### Query Optimization
- Index categories by teamId and isActive
- Index evidence by teamId and tag categoryIds
- Denormalize category/tag names for faster search
- Cache frequently accessed categories

### UI Performance
- Lazy load category options
- Debounced search with structured tags
- Virtual scrolling for large tag lists
- Efficient color calculation for variations

## Risk Mitigation

### Data Safety
- **No Destructive Changes**: Legacy tags preserved indefinitely
- **Rollback Capability**: v1.0 functionality remains available
- **Gradual Migration**: Users control migration pace
- **Backup Strategy**: Category changes backed up before major operations

### User Adoption
- **Optional Migration**: Users not forced to migrate immediately  
- **Familiar Interface**: Similar to v1.0 with enhancements
- **Clear Benefits**: Visual organization and structured data
- **Help Documentation**: Migration guides and category examples

## Success Metrics

### Functionality Metrics
- [ ] All v1.0 features continue to work
- [ ] Category CRUD operations complete successfully
- [ ] Tag assignment works across multiple categories
- [ ] Search includes both structured and legacy tags
- [ ] Color coding displays correctly

### User Experience Metrics
- [ ] Migration dialog completion rate >70%
- [ ] Average tags per document increases
- [ ] Search effectiveness improves with structured tags
- [ ] Time to find documents decreases
- [ ] User satisfaction with visual organization

### Technical Metrics
- [ ] Page load times remain <2 seconds
- [ ] Tag assignment operations complete <500ms
- [ ] Search response time <300ms
- [ ] Migration process handles >1000 legacy tags
- [ ] Color system supports >20 categories

## Future Preparation

### v1.2 AI Integration Readiness
- Structured tag data format matches AI output requirements
- Category system provides framework for AI suggestions
- Tag confidence scores can be added to existing structure
- Batch processing architecture compatible with category-based workflow

### Scalability Considerations
- Category system supports unlimited user-defined categories
- Tag structure supports hierarchical extensions
- Color system expandable beyond current palette
- Search architecture supports advanced filtering combinations

## Conclusion

Version 1.1 transforms the Organizer from a simple tagging system into a structured, visually organized category system while maintaining full backward compatibility with v1.0. This foundation enables more sophisticated AI processing in v1.2 and provides users with immediate benefits through better organization and visual clarity.

The implementation prioritizes user experience through optional migration, preserved functionality, and clear visual improvements. The technical architecture ensures scalability and compatibility with future versions while delivering immediate value to users who have already adopted v1.0.

### Component Architecture

#### New Components
1. **CategoryManager.vue** - Main category management interface
2. **CategoryForm.vue** - Create/edit individual categories
3. **TagSelector.vue** - Replaces TagInput.vue with category-based selection
4. **ColorPicker.vue** - Category color selection component
5. **MigrationDialog.vue** - Migrate v1.0 tags to categories

#### Updated Components
1. **Organizer.vue** - Updated layout for category management access
2. **EvidenceCard.vue** - Updated tag display with color coding
3. **OrganizerStore.js** - Enhanced with category management logic

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Data Structure & Backend (Week 1)
- [ ] Create categories collection schema
- [ ] Update Evidence structure for structured tags
- [ ] Create category service (CRUD operations)
- [ ] Add category seeding for first-time users
- [ ] Implement data migration utilities

### Phase 2: Category Management UI (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Build CategoryManager.vue interface
- [ ] Create CategoryForm.vue for add/edit
- [ ] Implement ColorPicker.vue component
- [ ] Add category management to navigation
- [ ] Create default categories on first visit

### Phase 3: Tag Assignment Interface (Week 2)
- [ ] Replace TagInput.vue with TagSelector.vue
- [ ] Category dropdown with tag selection
- [ ] Multi-category tag assignment
- [ ] Color-coded tag display
- [ ] Real-time tag updates

### Phase 4: Migration & Compatibility (Week 2-3)
- [ ] Build MigrationDialog.vue for v1.0 tags
- [ ] Legacy tag display and management
- [ ] Batch migration utilities
- [ ] Preserve search functionality for legacy tags

### Phase 5: Enhanced Search & Display (Week 3)
- [ ] Update search to handle structured tags
- [ ] Enhanced filtering by category
- [ ] Color-coded tag chips in results
- [ ] Category-based organization in results

### Phase 6: Testing & Polish (Week 3)
- [ ] Comprehensive testing of category CRUD
- [ ] Tag assignment/removal testing
- [ ] Migration testing with v1.0 data
- [ ] Performance testing with large datasets
- [ ] UX polish and error handling

## Detailed Implementation Specifications

### CategoryManager.vue Interface

### Migration Strategy

#### v1.0 Compatibility
1. **Preserve Legacy Tags**: Store original v1.0 tags in `legacyTags` array
2. **Search Integration**: Include legacy tags in search results
3. **Gradual Migration**: Optional migration dialog for converting old tags
4. **Fallback Display**: Show legacy tags when no structured tags exist

#### Migration Dialog
